Sentencas: Direct utilization of hydrocarbons in low temperature solid oxide fuel cells is of growing interest in the landscape of alternative energy technologies.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas

Sentencas: Here, we report on performance of self-supported microsolid oxide fuel cells (mu SOFCs) with ruthenium (Ru) nano-porous thin film anodes operating in natural gas and methane.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas

Sentencas: The mu SOFCs consist of 8 mol% yttria-stabilized zirconia thin film electrolytes, porous platinum cathodes and porous Ru anodes, and were tested with dry natural gas and methane as fuels and air as the oxidant.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas

Sentencas: At 500 degrees C, comparable power densities of 410 mW cm(-2) and 440 mW cm(-2) were obtained with dry natural gas and methane, respectively.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas

Sentencas: In weakly humidified natural gas, open circuit voltage of 0.95 V at 530 degrees C with peak power density of 800 mW cm(-2) was realized.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas

Sentencas: The mu SOFC was continuously operated at constant voltage of 0.7 V with methane, where quasi-periodic oscillatory behavior of the performance was observed.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas

Sentencas: Through post-operation XPS studies it was found that the oxidation state of Ru anode surfaces significantly differs depending on the fuel used, oxidation being enhanced with methane or natural gas.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas

Sentencas: The nature of the oscillation is discussed based on the transition in surface oxygen coverage states and electro-catalytic activity of Ru anodes.
Titulo: Operational characteristics of thin film solid oxide fuel cells with ruthenium anode in natural gas
